ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńgÿo ńgwɔ́ tà kúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi náa né pi páʼ tÿɔgɔ́, pi lɔɔn ńgÿo ńzyɛ́ʼ kú, tà ńcʉ́ʼʉ tsẅé pɔ́ wó,
en: “When you enter the land the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance,   and you take possession of it and live in it,

ngiemboon: wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ, lag ntwó shúm sie à jʉʼʉ́ nkáʼ, á tsɛ̀ɛ wɛ̌ ngwòŋ, ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ túŋ, ńdɔg ńgʉa né jʉʼ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à ge gÿo záb páʼ à ge tsẅé wó.
en: take some of the first of all the land’s produce that you harvest from the land the Lord your God is giving you and put it in a basket. Then go to the place where the Lord your God chooses to have his name dwell.

ngiemboon: É kúu jʉʼó, é gyá nùŋepwɔʼ gẅie aa ssé fʉʼó, é gɔɔn né yé ngie: «N gee lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn páʼɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ngyè lekág ńgɔɔn mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé jù, ngie mèŋ n gʉ̌a tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie, yé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la kʉa mbwó metá pégè ngie à ge láʼ ná né pege.»
en: When you come before the priest who is serving at that time, say to him, ‘Today I declare to the Lord your   God that I have entered the land the Lord swore to our ancestors to give us.’

ngiemboon: Anùŋepwɔʼ leen ńké, éfó mbwó yé ńkẅé túŋ, ńtÿɔ́gɔ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi.
en: “Then the priest will take the basket from you and place it before the altar of the Lord your God.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à tǒ léná shúm pwɔʼ, leen ńké ńtyé mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a é Ssé gi, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Mángʉanjʉʼ weg, à laa nyìŋ Alam, ńgwá ńkʉ́ʼʉ kʉʼʉ́, à la lɔg mbɔ́ntáʼ pʉ̀a, ńcwóŋ né ngwòŋ Egíbtò, ńnéŋe wó páʼ kÿoláʼ. Pɔ́ leen ńcʉ́ʼʉ máamáa láʼ gie á gyɔ́ɔn, ḿbiŋ ńtʉ.
en: You are to respond by saying in the presence of the Lord your God:

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Egíbtò la pú ńnẅɛɛ wég, ḿbú ńnáa wég ngɔ́ʼ, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo peg faʼ mefàʼ ntʉtʉ páʼ menkwɔɔn.
en: But the Egyptians mistreated and oppressed us, and forced us to do hard labor.

ngiemboon: Peg gaʼte, ńtóŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé pamángʉanjʉʼ pég. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a júʼ ngyè yeg, ńgyá ngɔ́ʼ yeg, ńgyá ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie peg ee tsoló.
en: So we called out to the Lord, the God of our ancestors, and the Lord heard our cry and saw our misery, hardship, and oppression.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò, ńkẅile wég. Ńcʉ́ʼʉ lékẅile wég, ńdɔgɔ máa ngʉ̀ʼ ye, lâ menkʉ̀ʼʉ menò, tà mbɔɔ menò mɔɔnmɔɔn; ńgÿo epʉ̀a pɔ́g.
en: Then the Lord brought us out of Egypt with a strong hand and an outstretched arm, with terrifying power, and with signs and wonders.

ngiemboon: À la lɔgɔ wég; ńtó né jʉʼɔɔn, ńná wɔɔn ngwòŋ né peg, é gwɔ́ ngwòŋ gẅie tsetsáʼ áa wó, ḿboŋo mmó tɛʼ, mélɛ̂g pɔ́ melwòŋwáʼ gwɔ́ wó tɛʼ.
en: He led us to this place and gave us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, mèŋ n dǎg ntwó shúm sie mèŋ ka jʉʼʉ na tsetsáʼ gie ɔ̀ la ná né mèŋ la, ńdɔg ńtó!» Wɛ̌ nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ gẅie à tǒo léná shúm pwɔʼ, à nuŋe sɛ̌ shúm á mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi; é ŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò yé tà zǐ yé kíbe ssé.
en: I have now brought the first of the land’s produce that you, Lord, have given me.

ngiemboon: À cʉ̀a púʼu, pi lâ pʉ̀a Lěvî lâ pakÿoláʼ pie ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, e pú ńkág, ńtí menò mbòŋo mie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à ka gÿo mbwó pi, mbɔɔ na metsìŋendá mí.
en: You, the Levites, and the resident aliens among you will rejoice   in all the good things the Lord your God has given you and your household.

ngiemboon: Mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ tá ntsèm, e ge láʼa gwɔ́ ngùʼ shúm pwɔʼ tàʼ nzsè na nzsè legém. Púʼu la, pi ge gee na shúm sí sie pi lagá nkáʼ, é gabte nzsè legém, é píi tàʼ nzsè; é náa mbwó pʉ̀a Lěvî, lâ pakÿoláʼ, tà mbɔɔ púɔ métsé, ńgÿo mepfɔ̌g panzwě, é pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ mí. Pɔ́ pfɛ́, páʼ pɔ́ kwǒŋ.
en: “When you have finished paying all the tenth of your produce in the third year,   the year of the tenth, you are to give it to the Levites, resident aliens, fatherless children, and widows, so that they may eat in your towns and be satisfied.

ngiemboon: Pi leen ńké ńtyé mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mèŋ fǒ ndá mèŋ, ńkẅile kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa jú, ńnáa mbwó pʉ̀a Lěvî, lâ pakÿoláʼ, tà mbɔɔ púɔ métsé, ńgÿo mepfɔ̌g panzwě, ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ membʉ̌ mú mie ɔ̀ la záb ńtí wég ne ńzɛ́te púʼu. N kaa fʉa tsɔ̌ tàʼ na membʉ̌ mú wɔ́, ńké te lege tsɔ̌ tàʼ wɔ́.
en: Then you will say in the presence of the Lord your God:

ngiemboon: N ka te gʉa na sɛ̌ shúm, ḿbíi tsɔ́ mmó ḿpfɛ́, á fʉ̀ʼ gie legwé ka kẅɛɛ na mèŋ wɔ́. N ka ké te gʉa mǒ, ńkẅile tsɔ́ mmó, á fʉ̀ʼ gie ncÿǒ kaa na mèŋ wɔ́; ńké te kẅile tsɔ́ mǒ, ńná lélɔg ńguʼte mpfó ssé wɔ́. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé yɔ̀ɔn, n ka júʼ ncwò gú. Ńgÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ, ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ ɔ̀ la tsẅi né mèŋ.
en: I have not eaten any of it while in mourning, or removed any of it while unclean, or offered any of it for the dead.   I have obeyed the Lord my God; I have done all you commanded me.

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, fó tÿǒ lepwó, á jʉʼ gie ɔ̀ néŋe wó, ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè na láʼ jú tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Ésàlayɛ, é ngwòŋ gẅie ɔ̀ la náa mbwó peg, páʼ ɔ̀ la kʉa mbwó metá pég púʼu. É ngwòŋ gẅie tsetsáʼ áa wó, ḿboŋo mmó tɛʼ, mélɛ̂g pɔ́ melwòŋwáʼ gwɔ́ wó tɛʼ.»
en: Look down from your holy dwelling, from heaven, and bless your people Israel and the land you have given us as you swore to our ancestors, a land flowing with milk and honey.

ngiemboon: Áa lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn páʼɔɔn, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, ne ńtsẅii né pi ngie pi giŋ páʼ membʉ̌ mé, ńgÿo memánzsè mé ne ńzɛ́te. Pi gẅiin létÿɔ́gɔ kwò mǒ, ḿbiŋ ńgiŋ páʼ é ne ńzɛ́te, lé letʉ́m sí ntsèm lé gẅi legwɔ́ ntsèm.
en: “The Lord your God is commanding you this day to follow these statutes and ordinances. Follow them carefully with all your heart and all your soul.

ngiemboon: Áa lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn páʼɔɔn, mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a kǎʼ ngie à ge gwɔ́ Ssé gi, à cʉa púʼu, pi gÿo mmó gie à ne ńkwoŋo, ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò na mentÿɔgɔ́ mé, lâ membʉ̌ mé, ńgÿo memánzsè mé, ḿbiŋ ńjúʼ ncwò wé;
en: Today you have affirmed that the Lord is your God and that you will walk in his ways, keep his statutes, commands, and ordinances, and obey him.

ngiemboon: áa lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn páʼɔɔn, mbà pi kaʼá mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a páʼ pi ge gwɔ́ kwaʼ pʉ̀a pé petʉ̀nzẅìŋ, ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ à la gɔɔn né pi; pi piŋ ńgiŋ páʼ membʉ̌ mé ntsèm ne ńzɛ́te;
en: And today the Lord has affirmed that you are his own possession as he promised you, that you are to keep all his commands,

ngiemboon: tá à cʉa púʼu, pi gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋ ntsèm mie à la nuŋe, ńgwɔ́ mendùŋmvfò pʉ̀a: mé pú ńná mekùʼ mí, ḿbú ńzsé gẅí, ḿbú ńgɔʼte gẅí. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi pʉ̀a pé, pi gwɔ́ ndʉalʉ̌a páʼ à la tsẅi.
en: that he will elevate you to praise, fame, and glory above all the nations he has made, and that you will be a holy people   to the Lord your God as he promised.”
